snippet: There was a clear winner in Tuesday's presidential election, and it was the statisticians who collectively parsed the polls far better than the old-style pundits. But those polls are getting more expensive and less reliable, as the country moves from...
abstract: There was a clear winner in Tuesday's presidential election, and it was the statisticians who collectively parsed the polls far better than the old-style pundits. But those polls are getting more expensive and less reliable, as the country moves from landlines to cellphones. Are Internet polls the answer?
